intro: Phaca lyallii, commonly known as Lyall's phaca, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Phaca lyallii plays a role in supporting local insect populations and is of interest to botanists studying New Zealand's unique flora.
